clinical_study.brief_title: Post-traumatic Stress Disease in Health Workers During COVID-19 Pandemia
clinical_study.official_title: PTSD in Health Workers During COVID-19 Pandemia

lead_sponsor.agency: Piazza della Vittoria 14 Studio Medico - Ginecologia e Ostetricia

clinical_study.source: Piazza della Vittoria 14 Studio Medico - Ginecologia e Ostetricia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the questionnaire is to find risk factors for the development of post-traumatic stress disease (PTSD) in health workers during COVID-19 pandemy.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with diagnosis of PTSD.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 months
primary_outcome.description: PTSD consists in job burnout, including emotional exhaustion, depersonalization, and personal accomplishment.

arm_group.description: They include doctors, nurses, techinicians, biologists and other non technical inhospital workers

intervention.description: The Maslach Burnout Inventory is an introspective psychological inventory consisting of 22 items pertaining to occupational burnout.

study_pop.textblock: The population consisted of workers in health services.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- workers in health services, including phisicians, nurses, inhospital technicians and biologists
